perturbation.original_text:
Program Member(s)" shall mean an Excite@Home Member who has:
i) Been provided access to the Co-Branded Application, and
ii) Has opted-in to allow all his or her registration information to
be shared with Application Provider and/or unspecified third
parties.
perturbation.changed_text: "Program Member(s)" shall mean any User who accesses the Co-Branded Application, regardless of whether they are an Excite@Home Member or whether they have consented to share their registration information.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Program Member' requires explicit consent for data sharing. The modified definition broadens the term to include all users, irrespective of consent, conflicting with data privacy regulations and creating ambiguity regarding data usage rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), and other state data privacy laws that require explicit consent for data sharing.

perturbation.original_text:
"Confidential Information" means
information about the disclosing party's (or its suppliers') business
or activities that is proprietary and confidential, which shall
include all business, financial, technical and other information of a
party marked or designated by such party as "confidential" or
"proprietary"Í¾ or information which, by the nature of the
circumstances surrounding the disclosure, ought in good faith to be
treated as confidential.
perturbation.changed_text: "Confidential Information" means any information exchanged between the parties, irrespective of whether it is marked as confidential or would reasonably be considered confidential under the circumstances.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition requires information to be either explicitly marked as confidential or inherently confidential based on the circumstances. The modified definition removes these conditions, making all exchanged information confidential. This conflicts with trade secret laws, which protect information that is actively kept secret and provides an unclear standard for determining what information is truly protected.

perturbation.original_text:
Either party may terminate the Agreement without penalty upon thirty (30)
days' written notice if regulations or applicable laws applied at the US
federal level regarding privacy or User Data purchase and/or usage impede
or prohibit said party from performing its services as contemplated by this
Agreement or thereafter.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party may terminate the Agreement without penalty if they subjectively believe that any regulation or applicable law, regardless of jurisdiction, potentially complicates their ability to fully realize projected profits from the agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original termination clause is triggered by US federal privacy laws that impede service performance. The modified clause allows termination based on a subjective belief of profit reduction due to any regulation, anywhere, creating an overly broad and easily abused condition for termination, against the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing under California contract law.
